item.description:
From the Darwin Day 2010 Facebook page: "Join the Humanist Chaplaincy at Harvard as we celebrate the discoveries and life of Darwin, the man who first described biological evolution via natural selection!

Celebrated around the world, Darwin Day is a new holiday available to people of all cultures, religions, and backgrounds united by our celebration of science and enlightenment. It seeks to acknowledge our global diversity, while celebrating our common humanity.

Join us this year for Darwin's 201st birthday -- and the kickoff to the Spring semester -- for birthday cake, games, and our famous Hopeful Monster Contest, sponsored by the Center for Naturalism. Food is provided by Tommy Doyle's and the first 75 drinks are on us!"

Note: These events can be a lot of fun, but you should be aware that in years past, the Harvard Darwin Day events have gotten crowded, especially later in the evening. If you're looking for a quieter or less crowded experience, plan to arrive early.
item.name: Harvard Humanists - Darwin Day Party
